standard_metadata.standard_description: Convert among different-sized standard measurement units within a given measurement system (e.g., convert 5 cm to 0.05 m), and use these conversions in solving multi-step, real world problems.

hints.content: $\begin{align} \blueD{112}\text{ ounces}&=\blueD{112}\text{  ounces} \times \dfrac{1\text{ pound}}{\greenD{16}\text{ ounces}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{112}\,\cancel{\text{ ounces}} \times 1\text{ pound}}{\greenD{16}\,\cancel{\text{ ounces}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{112}\text{ pounds}}\greenD{16} \\\\ &={\blueD{112}\text{ pounds}}\div\greenD{16} \\\\ &= \blueD{7} \text{ pounds} \end{align}$

$\begin{align} \blueD{98}\text{ cups}&=\blueD{98}\text{  cups} \times \dfrac{1\text{ pint}}{\greenD{2}\text{ cups}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{98}\,\cancel{\text{ cups}} \times 1\text{ pint}}{\greenD{2}\,\cancel{\text{ cups}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{98}\text{ pints}}\greenD{2} \\\\ &={\blueD{98}\text{ pints}}\div\greenD{2} \\\\ &= \blueD{49} \text{ pints} \end{align}$

$\begin{align} \blueD{140}\text{ quarts}&=\blueD{140}\text{  quarts} \times \dfrac{1\text{ gallon}}{\greenD{4}\text{ quarts}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{140}\,\cancel{\text{ quarts}} \times 1\text{ gallon}}{\greenD{4}\,\cancel{\text{ quarts}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{140}\text{ gallons}}\greenD{4} \\\\ &={\blueD{140}\text{ gallons}}\div\greenD{4} \\\\ &= \blueD{35} \text{ gallons} \end{align}$

$\begin{align} \blueD{180}\text{ inches}&=\blueD{180}\text{  inches} \times \dfrac{1\text{ foot}}{\greenD{12}\text{ inches}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{180}\,\cancel{\text{ inches}} \times 1\text{ foot}}{\greenD{12}\,\cancel{\text{ inches}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{180}\text{ feet}}\greenD{12} \\\\ &={\blueD{180}\text{ feet}}\div\greenD{12} \\\\ &= \blueD{15} \text{ feet} \end{align}$

$\begin{align} \blueD{51}\text{ feet}&=\blueD{51}\text{  feet} \times \dfrac{1\text{ yard}}{\greenD{3}\text{ feet}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{51}\,\cancel{\text{ feet}} \times 1\text{ yard}}{\greenD{3}\,\cancel{\text{ feet}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{51}\text{ yards}}\greenD{3} \\\\ &={\blueD{51}\text{ yards}}\div\greenD{3} \\\\ &= \blueD{17} \text{ yards} \end{align}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in ounces and pounds.**  Ounces | Pounds :-: | :-: $16$ |  $1$  | $5$ $144$|

hints.content: First, let's see how many ounces are in $\maroonD5$ pounds.    $\maroonD{5}  \text{ pounds}= \maroonD{5}\times\greenD{16}=\maroonD{80}\text{ ounces}$

Next, let's convert $\blueD{144}$ ounces to pounds.  $\begin{align} \blueD{144}\text{ ounces}&=\blueD{144}\text{  ounces} \times \dfrac{1\text{ pound}}{\greenD{16}\text{ ounces}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{144}\,\cancel{\text{ ounces}} \times 1\text{ pound}}{\greenD{16}\,\cancel{\text{ ounces}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\blueD{144}\text{ pounds}}\greenD{16} \\\\ &={\blueD{144}\text{ pounds}}\div\greenD{16} \\\\ &= \blueD{9} \text{ pounds} \end{align}$
Here is the completed table:  Ounces| Pounds  :-: | :-: $16$ |  $1$ $\maroonD{80}$ | $5$ $144$ | $\blueD9$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in ounces and pounds.**  Ounces | Pounds :-: | :-: $16$ | $1$ $160$ |   | $14$

hints.content: First, let's convert $\maroonD{160}$ ounces to pounds.  $\begin{align} \maroonD{160}\text{ ounces}&=\maroonD{160}\text{  ounces} \times \dfrac{1\text{ pound}}{\greenD{16}\text{ ounces}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{160}\,\cancel{\text{ ounces}} \times 1\text{ pound}}{\greenD{16}\,\cancel{\text{ ounces}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{160}\text{ pounds}}\greenD{16} \\\\ &={\maroonD{160}\text{ pounds}}\div\greenD{16} \\\\ &= \maroonD{10} \text{ pounds} \end{align}$
Now, let's see how many ounces are in  $\blueD{14}$ pounds.    $ \blueD{14}  \text{ pounds}= \blueD{14}\times\greenD{16}=\blueD{224}\text{ ounces}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in pints and quarts.**  Pints | Quarts :-: | :-: $2$ | $1$ $24$ |   | $23$

hints.content: First, let's convert $\maroonD{24}$ pints  to quarts.  $\begin{align} \maroonD{24}\text{ pints}&=\maroonD{24}\text{  pints} \times \dfrac{1\text{ quart}}{\greenD{2}\text{ pints}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{24}\,\cancel{\text{ pints}} \times 1\text{ quart}}{\greenD{2}\,\cancel{\text{ pints}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{24}\text{ quarts}}\greenD{2} \\\\ &={\maroonD{24}\text{ quarts}}\div\greenD{2} \\\\ &= \maroonD{12} \text{ quarts} \end{align}$
Now, let's see how many pints are in  $\blueD{23}$ quarts.    $\blueD{23}  \text{ quarts}= \blueD{23}\times\greenD{2}=\blueD{46}\text{ pints}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in quarts and gallons.**  Quarts | Gallons :-: | :-: $4$ | $1$ | $7$ $60$|

hints.content: First,  let's see how many quarts are in $\blueD{7}$ gallons.  $\blueD{7}  \text{ gallons}= \blueD{7}\times\greenD{4}=\blueD{28}\text{ quarts}$

Now, let's convert $\maroonD{60}$ quarts to gallons.  $\begin{align} \maroonD{60}\text{ quarts}&=\maroonD{60}\text{  quarts} \times \dfrac{1\text{ gallon}}{\greenD{4}\text{ quarts}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{60}\,\cancel{\text{ quarts}} \times 1\text{ gallon}}{\greenD{4}\,\cancel{\text{ quarts}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{60}\text{ gallons}}\greenD{4} \\\\ &={\maroonD{60}\text{ gallons}}\div\greenD{4} \\\\ &= \maroonD{15} \text{ gallons} \end{align}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in yards and miles.**  Yards | Miles :-: | :-: $1{,}760$|$1$    | $8$ $17{,}600$|

hints.content: First, let's convert $\maroonD{17{,}600}$ yards to miles.  $\begin{align} \maroonD{17{,}600}\text{ yards}&=\maroonD{17{,}600}\text{  yards} \times \dfrac{1\text{ mile}}{\greenD{1{,}760}\text{ yards}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{17{,}600}\,\cancel{\text{ yards}} \times 1\text{ mile}}{\greenD{1{,}760}\,\cancel{\text{ yards}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{17{,}600}\text{ miles}}\greenD{1{,}760} \\\\ &={\maroonD{17{,}600}\text{ miles}}\div\greenD{1{,}760} \\\\ &= \maroonD{10} \text{ miles} \end{align}$
Now, let's see how many yards are in $\blueD{8}$ miles.  $\blueD{8}  \text{ miles}= \blueD{8}\times\greenD{1{,}760}=\blueD{14{,}080}\text{ yards}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in cups and pints.**  Cups | Pints :-: | :-: $2$|$1$ |$13$ $84$|

hints.content: First, let's convert  $\maroonD{84}$ cups to pints.  $\begin{align} \maroonD{84}\text{ cups}&=\maroonD{84}\text{  cups} \times \dfrac{1\text{ pint}}{\greenD{2}\text{ cups}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{84}\,\cancel{\text{ cups}} \times 1\text{ pint}}{\greenD{2}\,\cancel{\text{ cups}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{84}\text{ pints}}\greenD{2} \\\\ &={\maroonD{84}\text{ pints}}\div\greenD{2} \\\\ &= \maroonD{42} \text{ pints} \end{align}$
Now, let's see how many cups are in $\blueD{13}$ pints.  $\blueD{13}  \text{ pints}= \blueD{13}\times\greenD{2}=\blueD{26}\text{ cups}$

question.content: **Complete the table to show equivalent measurements in inches and feet.**  Inches | Feet :-: | :-: $12$|$1$ $72$|   | $9$

hints.content: First, let's convert $\maroonD{72}$ inches to feet.  $\begin{align} \maroonD{72}\text{ inches}&=\maroonD{72}\text{  inches} \times \dfrac{1\text{ foot}}{\greenD{12}\text{ inches}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{72}\,\cancel{\text{ inches}} \times 1\text{ foot}}{\greenD{12}\,\cancel{\text{ inches}}}  \\\\ &=\dfrac{\maroonD{72}\text{ feet}}\greenD{12} \\\\ &={\maroonD{72}\text{ feet}}\div\greenD{12} \\\\ &= \maroonD{6} \text{ feet} \end{align}$
Now, let's see how many inches are in $\blueD{9}$ feet.  $\blueD{9}  \text{ feet}= \blueD{9}\times\greenD{12}=\blueD{108}\text{ inches}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD{5}$ gallons to quarts.
Now, we can compare.  ${24}\text{ quarts} >\blueD{20}\text{ quarts}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD{11}$ yards to feet.
Now, we can compare.  $\blueD{33}\text{ feet} <{51}\text{ feet}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD{4}$ pounds to ounces.
Now, we can compare.  ${64}\text{ ounces} =\blueD{64}\text{ ounces}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD{3}$ feet to inches.
Now, we can compare.  $\blueD{36}\text{ inches} < {41}\text{ inches}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD{8}$ pounds to ounces.
Now, we can compare.  $\blueD{128}\text{ ounces} > {96}\text{ ounces}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD{23}$ pints to cups.
Now, we can compare.  $\blueD{46}\text{ cups} ={46}\text{ cups}$
To compare, we need the numbers to have the same units.    Let's convert $\blueD{3}$ miles to yards.
Now, we can compare.  $\blueD{5{,}280}\text{ yards} >{5{,}000}\text{ yards}$
